content:
Diagnosis
	1. Oncocytic adrenocortical carcinoma with lung metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Right adrenalectomy

	Systemic therapy
	1. Mitotane commenced Feb 2024, titrated to therapeutic range
	2. EDP (Etoposide, Doxorubicin, Cisplatin) commenced March 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on imaging

	Current issues
	1. Mitotane-induced nausea
	2. Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today prior to cycle 4 EDP. Latest CT chest/abdomen/pelvis from 15/5/24 shows stable disease with no new metastases. Lung nodules stable in size and number. Post-surgical bed appearances unchanged.

Mitotane levels now therapeutic at 15 mg/L. Steroid replacement adequate with no features of adrenal insufficiency. Experiencing ongoing grade 2 neuropathy affecting fingers and toes, but maintaining function. Some nausea with mitotane despite maximal antiemetics.

Examination shows?stable respiratory findings?with clear chest examination.?Surgical wound well healed.?Performance status remains 1.

	Further investigations
	Mitotane levels and cortisol day curve in 2 weeks

	Medication prescribed
	Increased domperidone to 10mg qds

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up with cycle 4 EDP in 2 weeks

	Required GP actions
	Weekly monitoring of mitotane levels to continue
